intro: Batrachium foeniculaceum, commonly known as the yellow batrachium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, palmate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
